review_text: The Kasa was just as described and very clean. I think it is a great option for those looking for a place to rest after exploring the city. The parking near the location is cheap (I recommend you download the app because other parking around the city uses the same system) and Square Café is a two-minute walk from the spot so you can grab a quick yummy breakfast before starting your day (get that breakfast burrito!). The only issue we had was with the automated noise sensors in each room. Like all automated stuff, they are pretty indiscriminate about your activity so if you have a dog that barks a little as you head out for non-dog friendly event, or have a sneeze attack that reaches too high a decibel, you'll get an email notice threatening to cancel your reservation which is not fun. That said, we were under the impression we could leave our pup in the room if we had to head out which was not the case and that's definitely on us. They later informed us that their pet policy requires you to never leave the dog alone at the Kasa which is something to keep in mind if you are looking to do stuff without your dog. Overall, I think the spot was a good choice and I recommend it to anyone looking to pass by the Burgh and can take pups to every location you're heading.

The kitchen is stocked full of great food. It was great to not have to immediately run to the grocery store. It was a really nice amenity and adds a lot of value for the price of your stay.
There were a few negatives (but I still wholeheartedly recommend Carrie’s place. ) The first negative is the metal stairs to the loft. The treads are little metal spikes pointed up! Be sure to bring slippers! The second is that there is a fair amount of dust in some of the nooks and crannies. The overall appearance is clean but it could use a more thorough dusting. Bring your allergy meds if you have allergies.
The toilet doesn’t have a powerful flush. I’m a petite woman and have NEVER needed a plunger before. Well, I guess there is a first for everything. :)
The shower gets warm but not quite hot. It wasn’t uncomfortable but I would have preferred it a little warmer.
We tried to use the oven and it made a horrible noise and so we turned it off. Carrie responded right away and said it was safe to use but the cooling fan needed to be fixed and a maintenance person was coming the next week.
Two kind of funny things. There are four lamps that are just for decorations and don’t have an outlet to plug them in. And there are also a LOT of pillows! Something like five on the couch, seven on the bed, and four extras in the drawers. But no extra blanket for the bed. I guess you should just bury yourself in pillows if you get cold!
But, seriously, you have to stay here. It is awesome and fun and the location can’t be beat. The off-street parking spot is also a huge perk.

review_text: SAFETY AND HARASSMENT! At check-in, my four digit key code did not work on the outside door I was supposed to use. I tried to use my code on the second outside door that was for the first floor, which I wasn't staying on, and it did not work. I tried the first door again - no luck. Second door again - it worked, though, again, not the correct floor. I went in, thinking there might be a mistake with the reservation and worried about not being able to get in period. My code opened one of the doors on the first floor, but it clearly was not "my" room, as there was other people's stuff in the room! Tried the first outside door again. Code worked. Went to third floor. After trying two to three times, my code opened the door to a room that was, I came to realize, also not the room I reserved. I did not realize it immediately, however, because (1) the room was empty, and (2), since my code worked, it seemed logical that this was my room. When leaving to go to dinner for which we had a timed reservation, I looked again at my check-in information and that is when I realized I was, alas, in the wrong room. Went to, at long last, the correct room where I found that my code also opened that door as well (after a few tries). I messaged Natalia about this on the way to dinner. She was concerned - not because my code opened so many doors - but because there was to be another party checking into the room my (and the two others in my party) stuff was in. I asked her if she or her cleaning lady or another could move the items. She said no because her cleaning lady lives 20 minutes away and she was 'over seas'. I offered to just stay in the room we were in, and allow the other party to take our room (which was quite an upgrade for them). Myself and my two friends (all three of us house wives pushing 50 on a girl's trip weekend) got back to "our" room sometime around 11 p.m. By 12:30 a.m. we were asleep. Beginning at 7 a.m. the next morning, and lasting until close to 8 a.m., I received 7 phone calls and 5 texts from Natalia, and I'm not sure how many messages through AirBnb from Richard (whom I assume is Natalia's husband), informing me that there were "multiple" complaints logged through the night about our being loud. I was told we had to "get out now!" various times or "security" would be sent to "remove us". First and foremost, this was disrespectful, at best, and more along the lines of harassment and bullying. If there were multiple complaints filed about our party between roughly 11 p.m. and midnight, why did we not hear about it until after 7 a.m. the next morning? And, if our laughing (there was no music playing, no tv on, no alcohol was consumed throughout our entire weekend) was so disturbing as to cause the need to file "multiple" complaints, than the walls must be paper thin. In fact, I feel obligated to add for others who may be considering this place that the doors that lead into each rented space are significantly thinner than the closet doors in my home. To make a long story longer, I would say there are three lessons to learn here. One, I should read my check-in directions more closely the next time I stay at an AirBnb (though it won't be this one) to be sure I'm going to the right room the first time. And, two, this particular place is INCREDIBLY unsafe. I was able to open FIVE doors with my "personal" code. I should have only been able to open two. Presumably, I could have opened every door - there is no good reason to think otherwise. And, finally, three - Natalia is unbelievably disrespectful, to the point of blatant harassment. The ONLY good thing I can say about this place is that it was clean, though I did kill an ant. Buyer beware.
